name: Mysore Masala Dosa
description: A famous dish from Mysore, Mysore Masala Dosa is a crispy rice crepe filled with a spicy and flavorful potato filling. The dosa is made by fermenting a rice and urad dal batter, which is then spread thin and cooked until crispy. The potato filling is a delicious mix of boiled potatoes, onions, and a special blend of spices, making it a perfect combination of textures and flavors.

name: Bisi Bele Bath
description: Bisi Bele Bath is a traditional rice dish from Karnataka, known for its spicy and tangy flavors. It is made with rice, toor dal, and a variety of vegetables, all cooked together with a special spice blend. The dish is typically served hot, garnished with fresh coriander leaves and a dollop of ghee, making it a comforting and hearty meal.

name: Ragi Mudde
description: Ragi Mudde is a staple food in rural Karnataka, especially in the Mysore region. It is made by cooking ragi flour with water to form soft, round balls. Ragi Mudde is known for its nutritional value, being rich in calcium and fiber. It is usually served with a spicy curry or sambar, making it a healthy and satisfying meal.

name: Mangalore Buns
description: Mangalore Buns are a popular breakfast or tea-time snack from the coastal city of Mangalore. These soft and sweet buns are made with ripe bananas, flour, and a hint of spices. The dough is fermented and deep-fried to create fluffy, golden buns that are slightly sweet and have a unique flavor. They are often enjoyed with coconut chutney or sambar.

name: Akki Roti
description: Akki Roti is a traditional Karnataka dish made from rice flour and mixed with finely chopped vegetables and spices. The dough is patted into thin rotis and cooked on a hot griddle until crispy. Akki Roti is typically served with coconut chutney or a spicy curry, making it a delicious and wholesome meal.

name: Neer Dosa
description: Neer Dosa is a delicate and soft dosa made from a batter of rice and coconut. Unlike traditional dosas, Neer Dosa does not require fermentation, making it quick and easy to prepare. The batter is spread thin on a hot griddle to create soft, lace-like dosas. Neer Dosa is often served with coconut chutney, sambar, or a spicy curry.

name: Udupi Sambar
description: Udupi Sambar is a flavorful and aromatic lentil-based vegetable stew from the Udupi region. Made with toor dal and a variety of vegetables, this sambar is cooked with a unique blend of spices and tamarind, giving it a tangy and spicy taste. It is typically served with rice or idli, making it a staple in Udupi cuisine.

name: Maddur Vada
description: Maddur Vada is a popular snack from the town of Maddur in Karnataka. These crispy vadas are made from a mixture of rice flour, semolina, onions, and spices. The dough is shaped into flat discs and deep-fried until golden brown. Maddur Vadas are known for their unique texture and savory flavor, making them a favorite teatime snack.

name: Avarekalu Saaru
description: Avarekalu Saaru is a traditional spicy and tangy curry made with avarekalu beans, also known as hyacinth beans. This dish is a winter specialty in Karnataka, especially in Bangalore. The curry is made with a blend of spices, coconut, and tamarind, creating a rich and flavorful gravy. It is typically served with rice or roti.

name: Chow Chow Bath
description: Chow Chow Bath is a unique combination of two contrasting dishes - Khara Bath and Kesari Bath. Khara Bath is a spicy semolina upma made with vegetables and spices, while Kesari Bath is a sweet semolina dessert flavored with saffron and ghee. The combination of these two dishes on a single plate offers a delightful mix of flavors and textures, making it a popular breakfast choice in Bangalore.

name: Holige
description: Holige, also known as Obbattu or Puran Poli, is a traditional sweet flatbread made during festivals and special occasions. It is made by stuffing a mixture of cooked chana dal and jaggery into a dough made from flour. The stuffed dough is then rolled out and cooked on a griddle until golden brown. Holige is soft, sweet, and aromatic, making it a beloved dessert in Karnataka.

name: Haalbai
description: Haalbai is a traditional sweet pudding from Karnataka, made with rice, coconut, jaggery, and flavored with cardamom. The ingredients are cooked together to form a thick, smooth pudding that is then allowed to set. Haalbai has a unique texture and a rich, sweet flavor, making it a popular dessert during festivals and celebrations.

name: Khara Bath
description: Khara Bath is a flavorful and spicy semolina upma made with vegetables and a blend of spices. It is a popular breakfast dish in Karnataka, especially in Bangalore. The semolina is cooked with onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and other vegetables, creating a soft and aromatic dish. Khara Bath is often served with coconut chutney or a dollop of ghee.

name: Vangi Bath
description: Vangi Bath is a delicious rice dish made with brinjals (eggplants) and a special blend of spices. The brinjals are sautéed with spices and mixed with cooked rice to create a flavorful and aromatic dish. Vangi Bath is a popular lunch dish in Karnataka and is often served with raita or a side of papad.

name: Obbattu
description: Obbattu, also known as Holige or Puran Poli, is a traditional sweet flatbread made during festivals and special occasions. It is made by stuffing a mixture of cooked chana dal and jaggery into a dough made from flour. The stuffed dough is then rolled out and cooked on a griddle until golden brown. Obbattu is soft, sweet, and aromatic, making it a beloved dessert in Karnataka.

name: Kosambari
description: Kosambari is a refreshing and healthy salad made with moong dal, cucumber, and coconut. This dish is a staple in Karnataka, especially during festivals and special occasions. The ingredients are mixed together with a simple dressing of lemon juice and spices, creating a fresh and crunchy salad that is both nutritious and delicious.

name: Gojju
description: Gojju is a tangy and spicy tamarind-based curry that is popular in Karnataka. It is made with tamarind, jaggery, and a blend of spices, creating a unique balance of sweet, sour, and spicy flavors. Gojju can be made with a variety of vegetables, such as okra, eggplant, or pineapple, and is typically served with rice or roti.

name: Kadle Manoli
description: Kadle Manoli is a spicy stir-fry made with black chickpeas (kadle) and ivy gourd (manoli). This dish is a specialty of the Mangalore region and is known for its unique combination of flavors and textures. The chickpeas and ivy gourd are cooked with a blend of spices, creating a savory and satisfying dish that is often served with rice or roti.

name: Menthya Soppu Saaru
description: Menthya Soppu Saaru is a spicy and tangy curry made with fenugreek leaves (menthya soppu) and lentils. This dish is a healthy and nutritious part of Karnataka cuisine, known for its unique flavor and health benefits. The fenugreek leaves are cooked with a blend of spices and lentils to create a rich and flavorful gravy that is typically served with rice or roti.

name: Rava Idli
description: Rava Idli is a popular breakfast dish in Karnataka, especially in Bangalore. These soft and fluffy idlis are made from semolina (rava) and curd, with a hint of spices. The batter is steamed to create light and airy idlis that are typically served with coconut chutney and sambar. Rava Idli is a quick and easy alternative to traditional rice idlis.

name: Kori Rotti
description: Kori Rotti is a traditional Mangalorean dish consisting of spicy chicken curry served with crispy rice rotti. The chicken is cooked in a rich coconut-based gravy with a blend of aromatic spices. The crispy rice rotti adds a unique texture to the dish, making it a perfect combination of flavors and textures.

name: Mutton Chops
description: Mutton Chops are a popular non-vegetarian dish in Karnataka, especially in Bangalore. The mutton chops are marinated with a blend of spices and then grilled to perfection. The result is a juicy and flavorful dish that is often served with a side of mint chutney and salad.

name: Fish Gassi
description: Fish Gassi is a traditional Mangalorean fish curry made with a rich coconut-based gravy and a blend of spices. The fish is cooked until tender and absorbs the tangy and spicy flavors of the gravy. This dish is typically served with rice or neer dosa, making it a flavorful and satisfying meal.

name: Chicken Sukka
description: Chicken Sukka is a dry chicken dish from the coastal region of Mangalore. The chicken is cooked with grated coconut, onions, and a blend of spices, creating a spicy and aromatic dish. Chicken Sukka is often served as a side dish with rice or roti, making it a popular choice in Mangalorean cuisine.

name: Mutton Biryani
description: Mutton Biryani is a flavorful rice dish made with spiced mutton and aromatic basmati rice. The mutton is cooked with a blend of spices and layered with partially cooked rice, creating a rich and aromatic biryani. This dish is a popular choice for special occasions and celebrations in Karnataka.

name: Chicken Kebab
description: Chicken Kebab is a popular non-vegetarian snack in Karnataka, especially in Bangalore. The chicken pieces are marinated with a blend of spices and then grilled or fried until juicy and flavorful. Chicken Kebab is often served with a side of mint chutney and salad, making it a perfect appetizer or snack.

name: Fish Fry
description: Fish Fry is a popular dish in the coastal region of Mangalore. The fish is marinated with a blend of spices and then deep-fried until crispy and golden brown. The result is a flavorful and crunchy fish that is often served with a side of rice or neer dosa.

name: Prawn Ghee Roast
description: Prawn Ghee Roast is a rich and flavorful dish from the coastal region of Mangalore. The prawns are cooked in ghee with a blend of spices, creating a spicy and aromatic dish. The ghee adds a rich and buttery flavor to the prawns, making it a popular choice for seafood lovers.

name: Kori Sukka
description: Kori Sukka is a dry chicken dish from Mangalore, similar to Chicken Sukka but with a unique blend of spices. The chicken is cooked with grated coconut, onions, and a special blend of spices, creating a spicy and aromatic dish. Kori Sukka is often served as a side dish with rice or roti.

name: Mutton Chukka
description: Mutton Chukka is a spicy and dry mutton dish that is a favorite in Karnataka, especially in Bangalore. The mutton is cooked with a blend of spices until it is tender and absorbs all the flavors. Mutton Chukka is often served as a side dish with rice or roti, making it a popular choice for non-vegetarian meals.

name: Crab Curry
description: Crab Curry is a rich and flavorful dish from the coastal region of Mangalore. The crab is cooked in a coconut-based gravy with a blend of spices, creating a spicy and aromatic dish. Crab Curry is often served with rice or neer dosa, making it a popular choice for seafood lovers.

name: Chicken 65
description: Chicken 65 is a popular non-vegetarian snack in Karnataka, especially in Bangalore. The chicken pieces are marinated with a blend of spices and then deep-fried until crispy and golden brown. Chicken 65 is often served with a side of mint chutney and salad, making it a perfect appetizer or snack.

name: Mutton Korma
description: Mutton Korma is a rich and aromatic dish from Karnataka, made with tender mutton pieces cooked in a yogurt-based gravy with a blend of spices. The yogurt adds a creamy texture to the dish, while the spices give it a rich and flavorful taste. Mutton Korma is often served with rice or naan, making it a popular choice for special occasions.

name: Fish Curry
description: Fish Curry is a staple dish in the coastal region of Mangalore. The fish is cooked in a tangy and spicy coconut-based gravy, creating a rich and flavorful dish. Fish Curry is often served with rice or neer dosa, making it a popular choice for seafood lovers.

name: Chicken Biryani
description: Chicken Biryani is a flavorful rice dish made with spiced chicken and aromatic basmati rice. The chicken is cooked with a blend of spices and layered with partially cooked rice, creating a rich and aromatic biryani. This dish is a popular choice for special occasions and celebrations in Karnataka.

name: Prawn Curry
description: Prawn Curry is a rich and flavorful dish from the coastal region of Mangalore. The prawns are cooked in a coconut-based gravy with a blend of spices, creating a spicy and aromatic dish. Prawn Curry is often served with rice or neer dosa, making it a popular choice for seafood lovers.

name: Chicken Ghee Roast
description: Chicken Ghee Roast is a rich and flavorful dish from the coastal region of Mangalore. The chicken is cooked in ghee with a blend of spices, creating a spicy and aromatic dish. The ghee adds a rich and buttery flavor to the chicken, making it a popular choice for non-vegetarian meals.

name: Mutton Curry
description: Mutton Curry is a rich and flavorful dish from Karnataka, especially in Bangalore. The mutton is cooked with a blend of spices until it is tender and absorbs all the flavors. Mutton Curry is often served with rice or roti, making it a popular choice for non-vegetarian meals.

name: Fish Pulimunchi
description: Fish Pulimunchi is a tangy and spicy fish curry from the coastal region of Mangalore. The fish is cooked in a tamarind-based gravy with a blend of spices, creating a rich and flavorful dish. Fish Pulimunchi is often served with rice or neer dosa, making it a popular choice for seafood lovers.

name: Chicken Kori Rotti
description: Chicken Kori Rotti is a traditional Mangalorean dish consisting of spicy chicken curry served with crispy rice rotti. The chicken is cooked in a rich coconut-based gravy with a blend of aromatic spices. The crispy rice rotti adds a unique texture to the dish, making it a perfect combination of flavors and textures.

name: Kori Ajadina
description: Kori Ajadina, also known as Chicken Sukka, is a dry chicken dish from Mangalore. The chicken is cooked with grated coconut, onions, and a blend of spices, creating a spicy and aromatic dish. This dish is often served as a side with rice or roti.

name: Mutton Pepper Fry
description: Mutton Pepper Fry is a spicy and flavorful dish from Bangalore. The mutton is cooked with black pepper and a blend of spices, creating a rich and aromatic dish. This dish is often served with rice or roti.

name: Crab Sukka
description: Crab Sukka is a dry crab dish from Mangalore. The crab is cooked with grated coconut, onions, and a blend of spices, creating a spicy and aromatic dish. This dish is often served as a side with rice or neer dosa.

name: Prawn Biryani
description: Prawn Biryani is a flavorful rice dish made with spiced prawns and aromatic basmati rice. The prawns are cooked with a blend of spices and layered with partially cooked rice, creating a rich and aromatic biryani. This dish is a popular choice for special occasions and celebrations.

name: Chicken Curry
description: Chicken Curry is a rich and flavorful dish from Karnataka. The chicken is cooked in a coconut-based gravy with a blend of spices, creating a spicy and aromatic dish. Chicken Curry is often served with rice or roti.

name: Mutton Rogan Josh
description: Mutton Rogan Josh is a rich and aromatic dish from Karnataka. The mutton is cooked in a yogurt-based gravy with a blend of spices, creating a rich and flavorful dish. Mutton Rogan Josh is often served with rice or naan.

name: Chicken Roast
description: Chicken Roast is a spicy and crispy dish from Karnataka. The chicken is marinated with a blend of spices and then roasted to perfection. Chicken Roast is often served with a side of mint chutney and salad.

name: Fish Pulusu
description: Fish Pulusu is a tangy and spicy fish curry from Mangalore. The fish is cooked in a tamarind-based gravy with a blend of spices, creating a rich and flavorful dish. Fish Pulusu is often served with rice or neer dosa.

name: Prawn Fry
description: Prawn Fry is a popular dish in the coastal region of Mangalore. The prawns are marinated with a blend of spices and then deep-fried until crispy and golden brown. Prawn Fry is often served with a side of rice or neer dosa.

name: Mutton Keema
description: Mutton Keema is a spicy and savory dish from Bangalore. The minced mutton is cooked with a blend of spices, creating a rich and flavorful dish. Mutton Keema is often served with rice or roti.
